themes.scientific_basis: Based on goal-setting theory (Locke & Latham) and research on shared relationship goals in long-term partnerships
themes.description: Evaluates how well couples align their individual and shared life goals, measuring their ability to create unified visions for their future while respecting individual aspirations

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in behavioral economics and research on financial compatibility in relationships (Dew et al., 2012)
themes.description: Assesses couples' compatibility in financial planning, spending habits, and long-term financial goals, including attitudes toward saving and investment

themes.scientific_basis: Based on family life cycle theory and research on relationship adaptation during major life transitions
themes.description: Measures how prepared couples are for major life changes (career shifts, relocation, starting a family) and their ability to support each other through transitions

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from values theory in psychology and research on shared values in relationship satisfaction
themes.description: Examines the alignment of core values and life priorities between partners, particularly regarding future lifestyle choices and major life decisions

themes.scientific_basis: Based on decision-making theory and research on collaborative problem-solving in relationships
themes.description: Evaluates how couples approach joint decision-making for future plans, including their ability to compromise and reach consensus on important life choices

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in temporal psychology and research on time perspective in relationship planning
themes.description: Assesses how well partners' timelines align for major life events and milestones, including their flexibility in adjusting personal timelines

themes.scientific_basis: Based on social support theory and research on mutual support in long-term relationships
themes.description: Measures how couples plan to support each other's future goals and aspirations, including career development and personal growth

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from risk assessment psychology and research on couples' approaches to uncertainty
themes.description: Examines how couples discuss and plan for potential future challenges, including their strategies for managing unexpected life events

themes.scientific_basis: Based on research on generativity (Erikson) and shared meaning in relationships
themes.description: Explores how couples envision their long-term impact and shared legacy, including their plans for family, community, and personal achievements

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in psychological flexibility research and studies on relationship resilience
themes.description: Measures couples' ability to adapt their future plans while maintaining relationship stability, including their openness to revising goals as circumstances change
